name: MERLIN
full_name: Parameter-Free Discovery of Arbitrary Length Anomalies in Massive Time Series Archives
paper: MERLIN++: parameter-free discovery of time series anomalies. Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery
description: MERLIN++ is an extension of MERLIN and a Matrix Profile-based algorithm that can efficiently and exactly find discords of all lengths in massive time series archives. The difference with MERLIN is that MERLIN++ is exploiting an indexing technique called Orchard’s algorithm.
bibtex: @article{10.1007/s10618-022-00876-7,author = {Nakamura, Takaaki and Mercer, Ryan and Imamura, Makoto and Keogh, Eamonn},title = {MERLIN++: parameter-free discovery of time series anomalies},year = {2023},issue_date = {Mar 2023},publisher = {Kluwer Academic Publishers},address = {USA},volume = {37},number = {2},issn = {1384-5810},doi = {10.1007/s10618-022-00876-7},journal = {Data Min. Knowl. Discov.},month = jan,pages = {670–709},numpages = {40},}
